comments.body:
Moved to proper category.

Clarified subject to help search results.

Thanks for your contribution.
this is a good idea because the update IS called village and pillage update BUT theres no such thing as a pillage only pillager outpost

Or maybe instead of a pillage there should be a Pillaged Village which is a battered up village that is decorated with pillager banners and colors and is inhabited by a variety of illagers. There could even be cages with iron golems and villagers inside them. The Pillaged Village could also always have a boss bar active until all of the illagers are killed
I think it should be called an illage and would have all kinds of illagers, such as Vindicators, Evokers, Witches, Ravagers and Pillagers.
I love the design but take away the vines because it kinds takes away the end feel. Or just make them purple.
They are actually a purple texture. They are just green because of how Minecraft deals with leaves and such
Maybe too detailed for Minecraft, but excellent nonetheless.
In that case..... Voted!
I updated the post, with some less complex designs
These look awesome! (And I like the complicated ones better)
NPCs are already too plentiful.  Generated structures are already too plentiful.  We do not need any more.
I nearly feel like this will just be stranger things
Something like that skulk dimention mod in minecraft:bedrock

Hello! It is presumed that all ideas are 'new', so we've edited your subject to make searching easier for folks.

Yeah, it would make much more sense if they had boats. And hey, if they bring boats along with them, then if you have no source of wood, that's free transportation off the island! Although I wonder if the game would have issues trying to spawn boats naturally.
They should only have one Llama with them in the boat. I can just imagine the player in a boat and then a Wandering Trader just rows up to them like "Boy have I traveled a long way to see you"
Also, I'm not sure if they do this already, bit Wandering Traders should have a higher pitched and/or more inquisitive "hmmm?" as if they are a salesperson
Traders spawn in open ocean. We now have chest boats. The aquatic traders should be in chest boats, not dragging around shark-food llamas.
https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&query=castle
That Would Be Awesome!
that is pretty cool

They probably should not be connected to strongholds for potential lore reasons, as strongholds are evidently deeply connected to the lore of Minecraft, and I think it's cruel to make them drop more when passive.

However, I love the idea of castles, and was going to recommend something similar myself. They would work really, really well with my ideas of siege weapons and spear walls, so maybe they could be connected vo villages and start sieges in a similar fashion to raids. There could also be a kind of advanced illager called a sieger, which would use siege weapons. During a siege, villagers would flee into the castle rather than just their houses.

They could even just be advanced villages with more/better golems. 

I think it would be better if they also generated in ice spikes and mega taigas, just to add some more purpose to those areas.
Really cool idea

i want a disc add on custom discs and i want turrets
what if we can make this using noteblocks
please elaberate
I like I like the ideas of having custom music disc. Mojang could a a noteblock that you connect a music box up with red stone then play tunes on the music box and it will save on the noteblock

Great idea. This would be especially nice in combination with note blocks. We already have map art, essentially giving minecraft players the ability to create their own paintings. A new 'empty disc' item you could 'burn' in a jukebox hooked up to redstone could accomplish something similar. You could hook up the jukebox with the blank disc to the song you made out of noteblocks and it would record the sounds onto it. You could then name and dye your disc. You could copy your creations (like maps/map art) onto blank discs to replicate them and more easily share them with friends. Like books, these could have the original creator on them and whether the disc is is the original or a copy. This level of custom music would allow for a lot more creativity within the game, much like what map art enabled.
Perfect idea, also make it available to build a jukebox and make a certain custom song or any song loop.
I want Disc1 - @$&@**%=n00biesculk
